comment._content: Another LOC photo here shows the same scene from further back, captioned "Paul Sorg, E. Fownes driving". This article from the 24 April 1903 NY Times mentions an incident where some property of "Paul A. Sorg" young millionaire of Middletown Ohio, was seized by a Sheriff just before Sorg was about to leave for Europe. An English "whip" (coach driver?) named Charles A. Fownes is also mentioned. There is a famous Paul John Sorg, but he was born in 1840 died in 1902. That appears to have been the father of Paul A. Sorg, listed in the article as 1878-1913--see Middletown Library, gives some family history: Paul Arthur Sorg was the son of Paul J. and Susan Jennie Sorg. His family was very well off financially and Paul A. Sorg was placed in charge of the paper concerns that the family owned...spent much time in New York State and raised excellent horses Here is a photo of Paul Arthur Sorg--that looks like it could be the person in the photo here--though it looks like he grew a mustache. Paul Arthur Sorg died 4 (?) May 1913 in New York, aged 34, according to the NY Times obituary from 6 May 1913. Seems pretty clear "Sorg" is Paul Arthur Sorg (circa 1878-1913). He appears to be examining the coach, could this have been the incident described in the NY Times article?
